built_in_tools.name: codebase_search
built_in_tools.description: Semantic search tool for finding code snippets and documentation relevant to queries. Best for understanding existing architecture and finding implementation patterns.

built_in_tools.name: read_file
built_in_tools.description: Read file contents with line range support. Essential for examining existing code, configuration files, and documentation to understand current implementation.

built_in_tools.name: edit_file
built_in_tools.description: Create new files or edit existing ones with precise line-by-line control. Primary tool for implementing new functionality and modifying existing code.

built_in_tools.name: search_replace
built_in_tools.description: Search and replace text in files with exact matching. Useful for making targeted changes to existing code without rewriting entire sections.

built_in_tools.name: run_terminal_cmd
built_in_tools.description: Execute terminal commands in the project directory. Essential for building, testing, running scripts, and managing dependencies.

built_in_tools.name: list_dir
built_in_tools.description: List directory contents to understand project structure. Critical for exploring codebases and planning file organization.

built_in_tools.name: grep_search
built_in_tools.description: Fast regex-based text search across files. Perfect for finding specific patterns, function names, and implementation details.

built_in_tools.name: file_search
built_in_tools.description: Fuzzy filename search to locate files by partial names. Useful when you know part of a filename but not the exact path.

user_resources.name: tanuki-pycharm-architecture.md
user_resources.description: Complete architecture specification for Tanuki-PyCharm system including 127 specialized agents, Cascade plugin integration, training methodology, and deployment strategy

user_resources.name: tanuki-programmer-architecture.md
user_resources.description: Base architecture document for the general Tanuki-Programmer system that provides foundational patterns and approaches

user_resources.name: cascade-plugin-codebase
user_resources.description: Existing PyCharm plugin with provider architecture, context management, file operations, and Plan/Act modes located at ../cascade/
